title: Font ID | Humanist maybe?
content:
I saw this type used on a logo, and for some reason I think it may be modified?  
Help in identifying it would be greatly appreciated, thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018044311im_/http:/typophile.com/files/caravus-type_3798.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [caravus-type.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018044311/http:/typophile.com/files/caravus-type.png) | 68.04 KB |
author: zerimar3

comments.content: Same feeling to me. Customized and may be from [Verdana](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018044311/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/verdana) or [Tahoma](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018044311/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/tahoma)...
Very interesting. I'm leaning more towards Tahoma. I'm going to see if I can get more information on this one.

I’m fairly convinced that this is based on [Apex Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018044311/http:/vllg.com/Constellation/Apex_Sans), the (ugly) precursor of Apex New, both by Chester Jenkins. Some letters match perfectly.
